p: In the plant world, a common line of defense is to produce a variety of toxic secondary compounds such as sesquiterpenes, alkaloids, and saponins which prevent predation by animals [ 14]. Early in the co-evolution of plant-animal relationships, some arthropod species began to utilize these chemical defenses of plants to protect themselves from their predators and parasites. It is likely, therefore, that the origins of herbal medicine have their roots deep within the animal kingdom [ 15].
